item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
You basically sell the code. When you reach the point in AV where you can get the code, it asks you to put in the name of the Billy character you want to give the bike to, and the code is then generated and locked to that Billy character.

And, no, it's not bannable, or alt abuse, or anything like that. You, the person, did the work, you, the person, get the reward.

Alt Abuse occurs when you use one of your Billy characters to benefit another one of your Billy characters. AV characters are considered completely different entities.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I don't see how someone's going to sell this item, seeing as it's not tradeableâ€¦ Unless you mean before using the code to get it. Though I think doing that is ban-able IIRC.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: It's because Billy and AV aren't really connected.

item.title: Abuse
item.content:encoded: I don't see what the difference between selling these and mainstream alt abuse is.

item.title: pika bike:
item.content:encoded: It's a referance to ash stealing (AKA "piking") misty's bike at the start of the pokemon anime :)
